channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: tech

item.title: 6 new Apple TV+ movies and shows to watch in November 2025
item.description: Every new Apple TV+ movie and show being released throughout November 2025 that you need to know about.
item.dc:creator: Amelia Schwanke, TechRadar

item.title: Trump admin begins developing new cybersecurity strategy
item.description: Sean Cairncross, the national cyber director, said he's looking to improve U.S. cyber strategy efforts by working with the private sector. The post Trump admin begins developing new cybersecurity strategy first appeared on Federal News Network.
item.dc:creator: Justin Doubleday, Federal News Network

item.title: Nvidia announces AI partnership with South Korea’s government, Samsung and Hyundai
item.description: Silicon Valley chipmaker Nvidia plans to supply hundreds of thousands of its graphics processing units for projects with South Korean businesses and the government to advance the country’s artificial intelligence infrastructure and technologies.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fast Company

item.title: Amazon carries Wall Street to the finish of another winning week and month
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Amazon led the U.S. stock market on Friday to the finish of another winning week and month. The S&P 500 rose 0.3% and pulled closer to its all-time high set on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: STAN CHOE, Associated Press, The Hill

item.title: Fast chargers are expanding quickly, but American EV drivers still fear running out of juice
item.description: Installing fast chargers is considered critical to supporting EV adoption because they can refill a fully electric vehicle in 20 minutes to an hour. Compare that to home chargers, which often take four to 10 hours.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, The Mercury News

item.title: YouTube TV just dropped over 20 Disney channels – here's where to watch them instead
item.description: As the YouTube TV and Disney Channel deal breaks down, over 20 channels are now missing – but there's still places to watch them.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Valentine, TechRadar

item.title: Hace falta una interrupción del servicio de AWS para priorizar la diversificación
item.description: A lo largo de lo años he advertido sobre los peligros de que las empresas dependan de un pequeño grupo de proveedores de nube dominantes, como AWS, Microsoft Azure y Google Cloud Platform.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Context engineering: Improving AI by moving beyond the prompt
item.description: Organizations deploying AI have focused heavily on prompt engineering as a method for generating the best results, but an emerging technique called context engineering will make AI tools more accurate and useful, experts say.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: From theory to practice: Innovating with AI
item.description: AI is the most high-profile area of ​​technology investment for global CIOs this year, according to 42% of respondents in Foundry’s recent State of the CIO 2025 survey. Interest is pervasive across all industries and geographies.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Stop trying to engineer data culture
item.description: Why do so many data initiatives struggle? Organizations have been investing heavily in data, analytics and AI for decades. The promise is clear and ambitious: Better reporting, more automation, sharper decisions and new insights that promise breakthrough innovations.
item.dc:creator: CIO

item.title: Learning from the AWS outage: Actions and resources
item.description: It has become cliché to say that the cloud is the backbone of digital transformation, but cloud outages like the recent AWS incident make enterprise dependence on the cloud painfully clear.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Nvidia partners with South Korean government, companies to boost AI development
item.description: Silicon Valley chipmaker Nvidia plans to supply its graphics processing units for projects with the South Korean businesses and government to advance the country’s artificial intelligence infrastructure and technologies.
item.dc:creator: Kim Tong-Hyung, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Microsoft deploys a fix to Azure cloud service that's hit with outage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Microsoft has deployed a fix to address an outage of their Azure cloud portal that left users unable to access Office 365, Minecraft and other services.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Nvidia has started the $5 trillion club. A look at its rise, by the numbers
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion. The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: Phony AI-generated videos of Hurricane Melissa flood social media sites
item.description: One viral video shows what appears to be four sharks swimming in a Jamaican hotel's pool as floodwaters allegedly brought on by Hurricane Melissa swamp the area. Another purportedly depicts Jamaica's Kingston airport completely ravaged by the storm.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SOBHAN and KELVIN CHAN, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Nvidia moves to build AI-native 5G/6G wireless stack for future networks
item.description: Nvidia is working with a cadre of industry expert at Booz Allen, Cisco, MITRE, ODC, Nokia and T-Mobile to bring an AI-native wireless stack for 6G networking to fruition.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Nvidia becomes world’s first $5 trillion company
item.description: Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company in the world to reach a $5 trillion valuation. The chipmaker’s stock jumped 3 percent at market open, pushing the company above the historic milestone.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: AI truck system matches top human drivers in massive safety showdown with perfect scores
item.description: Kodiak Driver autonomous truck achieves perfect 98 safety score, matching top human fleets in groundbreaking AI evaluation by Nauto's VERA system.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: The quiet glory of REST and JSON
item.description: I don’t expect that many developers today fully appreciate the quiet glory that is REST and JSON. But then, most developers today have not been around the software business as long as I have. It’s only natural that we old timers have a clearer idea of how incredibly far the technology has come.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: IBM expands professional services for Cisco firewalls
item.description: IBM Technology Lifecycle Services has added Cisco’s firewall technology to its enterprise menu, expanding the range of technical services TLS offers for virtual and physical firewalls. IBM TLS will service Cisco’s Secure Firewall platform which is a core part of its Hybrid Mesh Firewall system.
item.dc:creator: Network World

item.title: Stragglers from Myanmar scam center raided by army cross into Thailand as buildings are blown up
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The number of people fleeing from Myanmar to Thailand after Myanmar’s military shut down a major online scam center has slowed to a trickle, a Thai regional army commander said Tuesday, after more than 1,500 had left in the past week.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: How to deploy an AI agent that actually solves help desk tickets
item.description: Help desks need help. But many of the agents coming to the rescue are chatbots in disguise. They claim to “resolve tickets” or “transform IT support,” but when you actually roll them out, most of these tools end up routing tickets, not resolving them.
item.dc:creator: Info World

item.title: Tesla revives 'Mad Max' mode in Full Self-Driving
item.description: Tesla's FSD v14.1.2 update reintroduces Mad Max mode, enabling higher speeds and more frequent lane changes than the standard Hurry profile setting.
item.dc:creator: Fox News
